pull.title: travis: Build with --enable-werror under OS X
pull.body:
Build with `--enable-werror` under OS X.

As suggested by @TheBlueMatt in #10866. This will allow catching violations using Travis CI which does a `clang` build for OS X.

events.body: Looks good to me, though I'm confused, in #10866 you indicated that these checks should fail, but travis passed here?

@TheBlueMatt Yes, that is a bit weird. I verified this change locally using these four tests before submitting the PR:

```shell
$ CC=clang CXX=clang++ ./configure --enable-werror && make clean && make check; echo $?
…
# fails as expected:
Makefile:5576: recipe for target 'libbitcoin_server_a-net_processing.o' failed
2
$ CC=clang CXX=clang++ ./configure && make clean && make check; echo $?
…
# passes as expected:
0
$ CC=gcc CXX=g++ ./configure --enable-werror && make clean && make check; echo $?
…
# passes as expected:
0
$ CC=gcc CXX=g++ ./configure && make clean && make check; echo $?
…
# passes as expected:
0
$ clang++ --version | head -1
clang version 3.8.0-2ubuntu4 (tags/RELEASE_380/final)
```

Locally everything works as expected.

Does the Travis CI build run with `--enable-werror`? I cannot find that in [.travis.yml](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/.travis.yml).
No, `--enable-werror` is currently not set on travis.
Great! Lets enable it by default at least on the osx build. Its deliberately heavily limited so no reason not to (also maybe do it by default, @theuni?).

Yea, I like this!

My only concern is that the annotations are infectious, so this may cause us to have to add them while doing large refactors where one annotation already exists. That's a good problem to have though, IMO.

utACK after #10866 goes in.
Looks like the travis failure was from building fontconfig, not the expected annotation-missing failure. Is it unrelated?

issue.title: Fix -Wthread-safety-analysis warnings. Compile with -Wthread-safety-analysis if available.
issue.body:
* Add mutex requirement for `AddToCompactExtraTransactions(…)`.
* Use `-Wthread-safety-analysis` if available.
* Rebased on top of https://github.com/TheBlueMatt/bitcoin/commits/2017-08-test-10923 - now includes: Fix -Wthread-safety-analysis warnings. Change the sync.h primitives to std from boost.

events.body: @TheBlueMatt Yes it appears to fail before hitting expected annotation-missing failure. I'm not sure about the root cause here. Can we as a first step re-trigger the Travis CI build?
@practicalswift OK, it has been kicked, I dont know how building fontconfig would have failed because of this, but hopefully its deterministic if it is an issue with this PR.

@TheBlueMatt Travis CI now complains about a locking issue but it is not the locking issue I'm encountering locally (locally I'm getting the error described in #10866). Is the locking issue reported by Travis a false positive?

@practicalswift hmm, well I got it to work by changing the sync.h primitives to std from boost (see https://travis-ci.org/TheBlueMatt/bitcoin/jobs/265262602 and https://github.com/TheBlueMatt/bitcoin/commits/2017-08-test-10923)

issue.title: Replace boost sleep_for with C++11 equivalent
issue.body:
Replaces `boost::thread::sleep_for` with C++ equivalent.
Removes ugly boost `sleep_for` version check and compatibility control structure.


Not meant for 0.15.

events.body:
@practicalswift as per meeting split the "enable werror on Travis" part from the Wthread-safety-analysis part. Maybe just leave this PR as the first and move the second back to the did-thread-safety-analysis pr?

On August 16, 2017 4:09:42 PM EDT, practicalswift <notifications@github.com> wrote:
>@TheBlueMatt Oh, nice! What is the best way to proceed from here? Shall
>I incorporate your changes into this PR or should I cherry-pick the
>individual commits?
>
>-- 
>You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
>Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
>https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10923#issuecomment-322884443
@TheBlueMatt What meeting? What am I missing? :-)
@TheBlueMatt PR updated. Looks good? :-)
@ptracticalswift the IRC meeting, Werror was discussed. Change the PR title?
@practicalswift wait, huh, I meant just do Werror here, and the thread-safety-analysis thing can go in #10866.
@TheBlueMatt Got it! I haven't attended any Bitcoin IRC channels/meetings - are there logs available somewhere? :-)
@practicalswift https://botbot.me/freenode/bitcoin-core-dev/
ACK

rename.to: travis: Build with --enable-werror under OS X

events.body: Prefixed the issue title with "travis:" otherwise it looks like all OSX builds will enable -werror, which is not the intent.

issue.title: Meta-issue: Add Clang thread safety analysis annotations
issue.body:
This meta-issue tracks the status of the Clang thread safety analysis PRs.

- [x] Fix `-Wthread-safety-analysis` warnings. Compile with `-Wthread-safety-analysis` if available. (#10866)
- [x] travis: Build with `--enable-werror` under OS X (#10923)
- [x] net: Add missing lock in `ProcessHeadersMessage(...)` (#11578)
- [x] addrman: Add missing lock in `Clear()` (CAddrMan) (#11585)
- [x] rpc: Lock `cs_main` in `blockToJSON`/`blockheaderToJSON` (#11618)
- [x] Avoid lock: Call `FlushStateToDisk(...)` regardless of `fCheckForPruning` (#11617)
- [x] tests: Add missing locks to tests (#11623)
- [x] Add missing `cs_wallet`/`cs_KeyStore` locks to wallet (#11634)
- [ ] Add missing locks: `validation.cpp` + related (#11652)
- [x] mempool: Fix missing locking in `CTxMemPool::check(…)` and `CTxMemPool::setSanityCheck(…)` (#11689)
- [x] qt: Remove redundant locks (#11733)
- [x] net: Add missing locks in `net.{cpp,h}` (#11744)
- [x] Avoid locking mutexes that are already held by the same thread (#11762)
- [x] net: Avoid locking `cs_vNodes` twice when calling `FindNode(...)`. Add `NodeExists(...)` (#11795)
- [x] tests: Make `test_bitcoin` pass under ThreadSanitzer (`clang`). Fix lock-order-inversion (potential deadlock). (#12882)
- [x] Add compile time checking for all `cs_KeyStore` runtime locking assertions (#13077)
- [x] mempool: Add compile time checking for all `::mempool.cs` runtime locking assertions (#13080)
- [x] wallet: Add compile time checking for all `cs_wallet` runtime locking assertions (#13081)
- [x] Add compile time checking for all `cs_main` runtime locking assertions (#13083)
- [x] wallet/keystore: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_KeyStore` (#13114)
- [x] addrman: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_addrMan` (#13115)
- [x] Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_{rpcWarmup,nTimeOffset,warnings}` (#13116)
- [x] net: Add Clang thread safety annotations for guarded variables in the networking code (#13123)
- [x] scheduler: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `m_cs_callbacks_pending` (#13125)
- [x] util: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_args` (#13126)
- [x] wallet: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_db` (#13127)
- [x] policy: Add Clang thread safety annotations for variables guarded by `cs_feeEstimator` (#13128)
- [x] Move `cs_main` locking annotations from `.cpp` to `.h` (#14063)
- [x] tests: Add missing locking annotations and locks (`g_cs_orphans`) (#14108)
- [x] Add compile time checking for `cs_main` locks which we assert at run time (#14444)

issue.title: build: Add MemorySanitizer (MSan) in Travis to detect use of uninitialized memory
issue.body:
Add MemorySanitizer (MSan) in Travis to detect use of uninitialized memory.

First UBSan, then ASan followed by TSan... and now: yes, the wait is over -- **MSan is finally here!** :)

Some historical context:
* 2017: Continuous compilation with Clang Thread Safety analysis enabled (#10866, #10923)
* 2018: Continuous testing with trapping on signed integer overflows (`-ftrapv`) (#12686)
* 2018: Continuous testing of use of locale dependent functions (#13041)
* 2018: Continuous testing of format strings (#13705)
* 2018: Continuous compilation with MSVC `TreatWarningAsError` (#14151)
* 2018: Continuous testing under UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer – UBSan (#14252, #14673, #17006)
* 2018: Continuous testing under AddressSanitizer – ASan (#14794, #17205, #17674)
* 2018: Continuous testing under ThreadSanitizer – TSan (#14829)
* 2019: Continuous testing in an unsigned char environment (`-funsigned-char`) (#15134)
* 2019: Continuous compile-time testing of assumptions we're making (#15391)
* 2019: Continuous testing of fuzz test cases under Valgrind (#17633, #18159, #18166)
* 2020: Finally... MemorySanitizer – MSAN! :)

What is the next step? What tools should we add to CI to keep bugs from entering `master`? :)
